steps.content: â€œBoujeeâ€ refers to someone who lives in luxury but remains humble. If someone is described as â€œboujee,â€ it means they worked hard to earn their wealth and live a luxurious lifestyle, but are still connected to their roots. Itâ€™s widely used slang in the African-American community, popularized by the release of the 2016 song â€œBad and Boujeeâ€ by hip-hop group Migos. steps.title: Use â€œboujeeâ€ to describe anything that looks fancy or expensive.
steps.content: Use â€œboujeeâ€ to describe anything that looks fancy or expensive. People use â€œboujeeâ€ to refer to flashy things or a luxurious lifestyle. steps.title: â€œBoujeeâ€ comes from the 16th-century French term â€œbourgeoisie.â€
steps.content: â€œBoujeeâ€ comes from the 16th-century French term â€œbourgeoisie.â€ The word â€œbourgeoisieâ€ refers to the middle class, or the social group between the rich and the poor. It was also a term used by German philosopher Karl Marx to describe how the property-owning class controlled the wealth and power in society. [3] X Research source By the 1970s, the term was shortened to â€œbougieâ€ and used to mock something as pretentious or consumeristic. In 2016, the Atlanta hip-hop group Migos released their song â€œBad and Boujee,â€ which peaked at number one on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. The song popularized the slang term â€œboujeeâ€ in African-American culture. [4] X Research source

steps.title: â€œBougieâ€ has a slightly more negative connotation than â€œboujee.â€
steps.content: â€œBougieâ€ has a slightly more negative connotation than â€œboujee.â€ While some people interchange both terms, â€œbougieâ€ is often used as an insult to describe someone whoâ€™s flashy or materialistic. â€œBoujee,â€ on the other hand, refers to someone who enjoys luxurious things, but made their wealth out of a poor upbringing and still remains humble.

steps.title: â€œBad and boujeeâ€ refers to an attractive and high maintenance person.
steps.content: â€œBad and boujeeâ€ refers to an attractive and high maintenance person. In the song â€œBad and Boujeeâ€ by Migos, the chorus repeats â€œmy b**** is bad and boujee.â€ The word â€œbadâ€ is slang for â€œhotâ€ or â€œsexy,â€ while the word â€œboujeeâ€ indicates a desire for the finer things in life. [5] X Research source â€œBand boujeeâ€ can be used to describe someone whoâ€™s highly attractive, confident, and lives a luxurious and high-maintenance lifestyle.

steps.title: Generally, itâ€™s okay to use â€œboujeeâ€ in casual and friendly contexts.
steps.content: Generally, itâ€™s okay to use â€œboujeeâ€ in casual and friendly contexts. Since â€œboujeeâ€ implies a distinctively African-American socio-economic experience, itâ€™s important to consider when and how you use it. Reserve it for casual and lighthearted conversations with loved ones, making sure that it describes something fancy or expensive. Avoid using it to stereotype someone or put them down. To use Black slang respectfully, make sure youâ€™re not using it in a performative way to â€œlevel upâ€ or earn credibility. If youâ€™re not close to the culture that originated the terms, it can seem like cultural appropriation. [6] X Research source
